The immune system, like any other system in the body, depends on adequate food intake and is very sensitive to nutritional deficits and imbalances. However, unlike other systems, the nutritional requirements of the immune system vary, very rapidly, depending on cell replication and synthesis, as well as other energy-demanding functions.
